problem.title: CheckPoint: Yo-Yo
problem.p: A yo-yo has an external radius R and an internal radius r. The mass of the yo-yo is m and its moment of inertia about an axis perpendicular to the screen and passing through its center of mass is I. The yo-yo is being pulled horizontally by a moderate force of magnitude F applied to a light string wrapped around the inner shaft as shown. The yo-yo rolls along a horizontal surface without slipping, at low values of F, as shown in the diagram.

If the magnitude of the force of friction has a magnitude \(F_f\), and the acceleration of the center of mass has a magnitude a, what is the correct expression for Newton's 2nd law for the yo-yo? (assume right to be positive)
